page.title: 17The Llandudno Lifeboat.
page.content: The{first Lifeboat Station,}dating from 1864, was built by the railway station. In an emergency the boat (a rowing boat) could be transported elsewhere, e.g. Conwy or Colwyn Bay, by train. {The second station}was built in 1902 in the centre of town, nextdoor to our school. {Why was it {built away from the beach?}The reason is that it is equidistant from the two main beaches, the North Shore and the West Shore. It is rectangular in shape and an extension was added to it in 1982. It accomodates both the main lifeboat and the inflatable in-shore rescue craft. The{present lifeboat}was built in 1963 at a cost of Â£28,000. Coloured white, red and blue, it is named{The {Lilly Wainwright}and bears the number 37.09. {(Continued on Page 18).
